intro: Eugeniopsis gardneriana, commonly known as the Gardner's eugenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest understory. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
